code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:white female sawmill worker aged 56 yrs presents via EMS a short time following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the back of the head (LOC 52 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 35 mph on impact. pt c/o severe headache, moderate nausea, mild vomiting and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 63 in, Weight 175 lbs, Temperature 98.5 F, Pulse 75, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 16, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

she was struck while passing through intersection ,

td.content: s:56 year old female presents for one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 52 min). she denies headache, nausea and vomiting since the accident. she has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). she has resumed usual state of function. o:Height 63 in, Weight 176 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 75, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=96,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=44,Reaction Time=0.48, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex
